rooms.description: Spacious living area with Kerala-style wooden ceilings and traditional murals. Positioned adjacent to the entrance for a welcoming ambiance.
A dining area integrated with the living room, featuring local stone flooring and wooden detailing.
Fully functional kitchen designed for efficiency with traditional Kerala storage systems. Adjacent to the dining area for easy access.
Master bedroom with ample natural light, designed with Kerala wooden carpentry and a small attached bathroom. Includes an ensuite.
Additional bedroom featuring traditional design elements and large windows for ample ventilation.
Secondary bedroom designed to balance the floor plan, following Vastu principles with north-east orientation where possible.
Child's bedroom located in a quiet corner of the house, designed with natural light and ventilation in mind.
Guest bedroom with flexible design to serve as an extra bedroom or study area.
Full bathroom located near the master bedroom, designed with traditional Kerala tiles and modern fixtures.
A dedicated library space integrated with reading nooks and ambient lighting, designed to promote calm and concentration. Placed in the eastern section of the house for positive energy.
Open balcony area providing a relaxing outdoor space, following traditional Kerala architecture with wooden balustrades and stone paving.
Entrance hall designed for a grand welcome, integrating traditional Kerala motifs with modern functionality. Placed to optimize entry from the west-facing plot.
Additional storage space integrated within the hall area, maintaining Vastu principles by being located in the north-west corner.
Service corridor linking various rooms, equipped with concealed utilities and designed for easy maintenance in accordance with local building norms.

openings.description: Main entrance door, designed in traditional Kerala style with wood carvings and a durable frame to withstand the humid climate.
Large windows placed throughout the house to ensure ample natural light while maintaining privacy, with shutters designed in local style.
Alcoves integrated into the wall design to provide decorative and practical storage, following local aesthetic practices.
Strategically placed ventilation openings to maintain airflow throughout the house, in accordance with traditional Kerala design and Vastu guidelines.
